sense.def: ① Pathological Condition of heat-type diseases affecting the regions above and below the diaphragm. Xuan ming lun fang 宣明論方 9 run fei san 潤肺散 , powder to moisten the lung: 治小兒膈熱 , “It cures diaphragm heat in children”.

② Illness Sign of heat in the regions above and below the diaphragm. Xuan ming lun fang 宣明論方 4: 眩悸 膈熱，坐臥不寧 , “[Patients experience] dizziness, palpitation, diaphragm heat , and are unable to sit or lie calmly”. Ge xiao 膈消 , diaphragm melting [2]

Pathological Condition identical with shang xiao 上消①， upper melting. SWBJQYBMJ Xiao ke lun: 上消者上焦受病，又謂之膈消病也。多飲水而少食，大便如常，或小 便清利，知其燥在上焦也 , “In the case of ‘upper melting’ the upper burner has been affected by a disease. It is also called ge xiao bing 膈消病 , disease of diaphragm melting . [Patients] drink a lot of water, and eat little. Defecation is normal. In some cases urine is clear and passes freely. This indicates that the upper burner is affected by dryness”.
